define.name: rop_fifo_depth
define.doc: ROP Fifo memory depth in EGW

define.name: flp_full_treshold
define.doc: number of elements in the FLPB lookup accessing FIFO, should be size of IPPB_FLPB_LOOKUP_ACCESS_LOOKUP_FIFO_3 - const: (less than the max queue size)

define.name: egw_max_opcode
define.doc: Maximum value for the EGW opcode

numeric.name: split_rpf
numeric.doc: Device use split or non-split FWD and RPF tables

numeric.name: thread_safety
numeric.doc: Device has KBP thread safety enabled

numeric.name: ipv4_large_mc_enable
numeric.doc: Device use large or small IPv4 multicast table

numeric.name: ipv6_large_mc_enable
numeric.doc: Device use large or small IPv6 multicast table

numeric.name: ipv4_mc_hash_table_size
numeric.doc: Number of SW entries for KBP IPv4 Multicast; Not relevant when IPv4 application is not enabled; Actual hash table size will be the smallest power fo 2, which can fit this size

numeric.name: ipv6_mc_hash_table_size
numeric.doc: Number of SW entries for KBP IPv6 Multicast; Not relevant when IPv6 application is not enabled; Actual hash table size will be the smallest power fo 2, which can fit this size

numeric.name: ipv4_mc_table_size
numeric.doc: Number of SW entries for KBP IPv4 Multicast; Not relevant when IPv4 application is not enabled

numeric.name: ipv6_mc_table_size
numeric.doc: Number of SW entries for KBP IPv6 Multicast; Not relevant when IPv6 application is not enabled

key.name: db
key.doc: DBAL table ID of the DB

value.name: initial_regular_capacity
value.doc: Initial capacity for the regular result type

value.name: initial_optimized_capacity
value.doc: Initial capacity for the optimized result type

value.name: xl_db
value.doc: Property value for extra large DB

value.name: zero_size_ad
value.doc: Indication if zero_size_ad needs to be initialized (OP2 suppot only)

value.name: dbal_none_direct_optimized
value.doc: Indicates if the DBAL NONE_DIRECT_OPTIMIZED indication should be set to the table for improving the insertion rate

value.name: reverse
value.doc: If set, reverse the lanes numbering order on elk device side

value.name: start_lane
value.doc: Start lane number for each kbp port.

value.name: port_core_mapping
value.doc: KBP port to Jericho2 core mapping.

table.name: kbp_serdes_tx_taps
table.doc: PHY TX tap configuration on KBP side per device

table.name: kbp_lane_serdes_tx_taps
table.doc: PHY TX tap configuration on KBP side per lane
